document.docAuthor: Santana, Vitória, Desiderio, Gleison Robson & Hamada, Neusa
document.docTitle: Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) boraceia Santana & Desiderio & Hamada 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) Müller 1879 (Trichoptera Hydropsychidae) from Atlantic Forest, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) Müller 1879 (Trichoptera Hydropsychidae) from Atlantic Forest, Brazil

heading.emphasis:
Smicridea ( Rhyacophylax ) boraceia
sp. nov. Santana, Desiderio & Hamada

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 1A–1F. Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) boraceia sp. nov., male. 1A, habitus, right lateral (in alcohol). 1B, head, right lateral. 1C, head, dorsal. 1D, right forewing, dorsal. 1E, right hind wing, dorsal. 1F, abdomen, ventral. Scale bars in mm: 1A = 2; 1B, 1C = 0.5; 1D, 1E, 1F = 1.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 2A–2F. Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) boraceia sp. nov., male genitalia. 2A, left lateral. 2B, dorsal. 2C, apex of tergum X, dorsal. 2D, phallic apparatus, left lateral. 2E, apex of phallic apparatus, left lateral. 2F, apex of phallic apparatus, dorsal. 2G, apex of phallic apparatus, paratype INPA-TRI000100, left lateral. 2H, apex of everted phallic apparatus paratype INPA- TRI000101, left lateral. Scale bar in mm: 2A, 2B = 0.2; 2C–2E = 0.01; 2F = 0.05.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 3. Geographical distributions of the two new species of Smicridea (Rhyacophylax) described in this study, in the Atlantic forest biome, S„o Paulo and Paraná states, Brazil.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Smicridea ( Rhyacophylax ) boraceia
sp. nov.
is most similar to
S . ( Rhyacophylax ) scalprum Vilarino, Dias & Calor 2019
by having tergum X concave at its apex in dorsal view, with lateral margins rounded forming a produced flap, strongly sclerotized, and with the apex of the phallotremal sclerite of the phallic apparatus with subtriangular lateral flap. However, S .
( R .) boraceia
sp. nov.
has six short, stout spines on the ventral region of the apicomesal lobe of tergum X, which are absent in S .
( R .) scalprum
. In addition, S .
( R .) boraceia
sp. nov.
can be recognized by the two medium-sized, apicolateral spines directed posterad and generally three apicoventral spines directed downward on the phallic apparatus (both absent in S .
( R .) scalprum
). Additionally, the new species has a pair of subapical, comma-shaped sclerites on the phallotremal sclerite of the phallic apparatus, in dorsal view.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1A–1F.
Smicridea ( Rhyacophylax ) boraceia
sp. nov.
, male. 1A, habitus, right lateral (in alcohol). 1B, head, right lateral. 1C, head, dorsal. 1D, right forewing, dorsal. 1E, right hind wing, dorsal. 1F, abdomen, ventral. Scale bars in mm: 1A = 2; 1B, 1C = 0.5; 1D, 1E, 1F = 1.

FIGURE 2A–2F.
Smicridea ( Rhyacophylax ) boraceia
sp. nov.
, male genitalia. 2A, left lateral. 2B, dorsal. 2C, apex of tergum X, dorsal. 2D, phallic apparatus, left lateral. 2E, apex of phallic apparatus, left lateral. 2F, apex of phallic apparatus, dorsal. 2G, apex of phallic apparatus, paratype INPA-TRI000100, left lateral. 2H, apex of everted phallic apparatus paratype INPA- TRI000101, left lateral. Scale bar in mm: 2A, 2B = 0.2; 2C–2E = 0.01; 2F = 0.05.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype male. BRAZIL : São Paulo :
Salesópolis
, Estaç „o Biológica de Boracéia , Casa Grande ,
15.xi.1974
, C.G. Froehlich leg., ( MZUSP 000351 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes :
same data as holotype, 15 males ( MZUSP )
;
same data, except Rio Claro , represa Casa Grande , 23º38’10.3”S , 45º49’57.1”W ,
856 m a.s.l.
, 5 males ,
23.i.2011
, L.L. Dumas & D.M. Takiya legs., (INPA-TRI 000100–104);
same data, except 10 males ( DZRJ )
;
same data, except 4 males ( DZUP )
.
Distribution. BRAZIL (Atlantic Forest: S„o Paulo state) ( Fig. 3 ).
Etymology. The specific epithet refers to Estaç„o Biológica de Boracéia where the specimens were collected. The name is a substantive in apposition, with unchanging gender.
